title: Don't Imprison Scotland (with Drew Hendry MP)
itunes:title: Don't Imprison Scotland (with Drew Hendry MP)
description:
After first minister Nicola Sturgeon was cleared of misleading parliament by an independent enquiry over the Alex Salmond investigation, the SNP are looking to the upcoming Holyrood elections to measure the damage the affair has done them and the cause of independence for Scotland.

Drew Hendry, SNP MP for Inverness, Nairn, Badenoch and Strathspey tells Bloomberg Westminster's Caroline Hepker and Roger Hearing he is confident voters will give the party more seats. He adds that the SNP will push for another independence referendum and if Boris Johnson blocks that, it will mean effectively keeping Scotland imprisoned in the union.

Plus Bloomberg Opinion columnist Therese Raphael joins to discuss the home secretary's push to toughen the rules on asylum seekers.
